title: World Tennis Conference 5 casts Gilles Cervara and Toni Nadal among key speakers
description: The World Tennis Conference is back in 2025 for its fifth edition, bringing together a stellar lineup of experts. The four-day event will feature some of the sport’s most influential coaches, players, and sports scientists. Among the headline speakers are Gilles Cervara, Louis Cayer and Toni Nadal. Supported by the ATP Tour, WTC5 aims to create a bridge of awareness between top coaches, scientists, leaders and experts in the sport. The informative event will be held virtually from 27-30 March. Attendees can look forward to 70 insightful presentations, including many from current ATP Tour coaches, along with eight live panels featuring 24 speakers. Additionally, special workshops will provide in-depth exploration of key topics. Sign up on the official World Tennis Conference 5 website: “Dream big, coach better!” All registered coaches will enjoy unlimited access to each presentation for more than 45 days, allowing them to absorb the knowledge at their own pace. They will also receive the exclusive WTC5 WorkBook, which compiles the Top 10 recommendations from each presenter. Other notable speakers at the event include Liam Smith, Claudio Pistolesi, Alberto Castellani, Emilio Sanchez Vicario, Kristof Vliegen, Rick Macci, Murphy Jensen, Domink Hrbaty, Dr. Jack Groppel, Dr. Jim Loehr, Robert Lindsted, Pepe Vendrell, Ali Ghelem, Dr. Ann Quinn, Dr. Roberto Vavassori, Carlos Kirmayr, Brett Hobden, Gordon Uehling, Diego Moyano, Tom Corrie, Robert Davis, Juan Manuel Esparcia, and many others. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Off Court News

Many ATP Tour coaches among 71 speakers at four-day virtual event

February 28, 2025

WTC

The fifth World Tennis Conference will be held virtually from 27-30 March. By ATP Staff

The World Tennis Conference is back in 2025 for its fifth edition, bringing together a stellar lineup of experts. The four-day event will feature some of the sport’s most influential coaches, players, and sports scientists. Among the headline speakers are Gilles Cervara, Louis Cayer and Toni Nadal.

Supported by the ATP Tour, WTC5 aims to create a bridge of awareness between top coaches, scientists, leaders and experts in the sport. The informative event will be held virtually from 27-30 March. Attendees can look forward to 70 insightful presentations, including many from current ATP Tour coaches, along with eight live panels featuring 24 speakers. Additionally, special workshops will provide in-depth exploration of key topics.

Sign up on the official World Tennis Conference 5 website: “Dream big, coach better!”

All registered coaches will enjoy unlimited access to each presentation for more than 45 days, allowing them to absorb the knowledge at their own pace. They will also receive the exclusive WTC5 WorkBook, which compiles the Top 10 recommendations from each presenter.

Other notable speakers at the event include Liam Smith, Claudio Pistolesi, Alberto Castellani, Emilio Sanchez Vicario, Kristof Vliegen, Rick Macci, Murphy Jensen, Domink Hrbaty, Dr. Jack Groppel, Dr. Jim Loehr, Robert Lindsted, Pepe Vendrell, Ali Ghelem, Dr. Ann Quinn, Dr. Roberto Vavassori, Carlos Kirmayr, Brett Hobden, Gordon Uehling, Diego Moyano, Tom Corrie, Robert Davis, Juan Manuel Esparcia, and many others.
